entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 1:14PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: As temperatures rise into the 80s through mid-week, area rivers and streams are forecast to rise to bankfull conditions from rapid snowmelt in higher elevations through at least Wednesday. For the Taiya River, hikers on the lower portion of the Chilkoot Trail should note that portions of the Chilkoot Trail could begin to inundate
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 4:29AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WELL ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES FOR EARLY THIS WEEK... Warm weather with well above normal daytime highs will persist through at least Tuesday for Southeast Alaska. Temperatures will rise to highs ranging from the mid 70s over more southerly locations to the mid 80s over northern and central locations and Misty Fjords.
